text: [Music]
uh what inspires me
[Music]
i guess going back to what i said
earlier what the main thing that
inspires me
is
to presumptuously want to improve
the circumstances in which i find myself
you know because i mean a lot of i mean
life of course is miraculous and amazing
but it can be really mundane
and one of the things that drives me in
music or art or what have you is the
desire to sort of
make life less mundane
you know and maybe it's a personal
failing of my own that i can never see i
mean because life is not mundane but to
me sometimes it can be kind of routine
and kind of mundane so i sort of
feel it's almost compulsion to challenge
that
i work under the assumption that
everybody is innately creative
but
and it's
you know maybe creativity is like a
plant you know or it's a seed and unless
it's watered and taken care of and
tended and put in a nice environment
it's never gonna grow it's never gonna
blossom i think everybody and it drives
me crazy that people don't give
themselves the license to be creative
and express themselves creatively
you know so many people in our culture
think of creativity as something that
someone else does
you know like
so many musicians
like bedroom people who really would
love to sit down and play piano they're
afraid to do so because they don't
they're intimidated by the people who
are really good at it the people who are
really good at it weren't born good at
it you know no one is born
a great pianist no one's born a great
painter no one's born a great
photographer it's like
you just take that spark and you keep
working on it
living green to me is something that
more often than i mean more often not
people do because it makes them feel
better about themselves which is great
there's nothing wrong with that
i
mean clearly
environmental degradation is the result
of cumulative effort you know like if
you open if china had one coal-fired
power plant it wouldn't be that bad the
fact that they open one coal-fired power
plant every week the cumulative effect
of that is really deleterious for the
global environment the same way
if a friend of mine replaces her
incandescent light bulbs with compact
fluorescent light bulbs
the effect on the environment is
negligible at best but if everybody in
the united states does that there will
actually be good consequences
so
living green i mean means different
things to different people um
but ultimately i guess it is that simple
choice like a choice between doing
something that's good for you and good
for the environment or doing something
that's bad for you and bad for the
environment so it
just seems like it makes sense to do the
thing that's good for you and good for
the environment
